document.docAuthor: Araújo, Magda H. S. & Ruiz, Gustavo R. S.
document.docTitle: Hypaeus tridactylus Araújo & Ruiz, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of four new species of Hypaeus Simon and redescription of H. taczanowskii Mello-Leitão (Araneae: Salticidae: Amycinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of four new species of Hypaeus Simon and redescription of H. taczanowskii Mello-Leitão (Araneae: Salticidae: Amycinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types . Holotype :
male from Acampamento Mutum (
2.551917 °S
,
56.224722 °W
), Juruti, Pará, Brazil ,
20 .II. 2011
, B.V.B. Rodrigues ( MPEG 21523 ).
Paratypes :
one female from Acampamento Mutum (
2.551917 °S
,
56.224722 °W
), Juruti, Brazil ,

, N.C. Bastos ( MPEG 21510 ); one male from Acampamento Mutum (
2.551917 °S
,
56.224917 °W
),
10 .I. 2012
, N.C. Bastos ( MPEG 21521 ); one female from Beneficiamento (
2.507611 °S
,
56.177639 °W
),
12 .VIII. 2010
, N.C. Bastos ( MPEG 21509 ).

Diagnosis. Males of
H. tridactylus
sp. nov.
are similar to those of
H. annulifer Simon
and
H. poseidon
sp. nov.
for having three projections on the palpal tibia [male of
H. pauciaculeis (Caporiacco)
is still unknown]. However, they can be distinguished from those of
H. annulifer
for the slender RTA forming a stronger hook (
Fig. 17
) and from
H. poseidon
sp. nov.
for the median portion of the embolus, flatter in this species (see arrows in Figs 16 , 27 ). Females of
H. tridactylus
sp. nov.
are similar to those of
H. poseidon
sp. nov.
and
H. pauciaculeis
in having the double pocket (female of
H. annulifer
is still unknown). However, they differ from those species by having juxtaposed pockets occupying an anterior position on the epigynal plate (
Fig. 19
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 12–15.
Hypaeus tridactylus
sp. nov.
12. male holotype, dorsal view; 13. female paratype (MPEG 21510), dorsal view; 14. male, ventral view; 15. female, ventral view.

FIGURES 16–21.
Hypaeus tridactylus
sp. nov.
16. left male palp (MPEG 21523), ventral view; 17. same, retrolateral view; 18. same, showing curved femur; 19 epigyne (MPEG 21510), ventral view; 20. same, cleared, ventral view; 21. same, cleared, dorsal view (PvTA: proventral tibial apophysis; RTA: retrolateral tibial apophysis; RvTA: retroventral tibial apophysis).

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Male. Total length: 5.22–6.65 . Carapace length: 2.80–3.18 . Length of leg I 7.60–9.97 . Female. Total length: 6.41–7.79 . Carapace length: 2.51–3.13 . Length of leg I: 5.55–7.31 .
